means: （使）集中， （使）聚集( focus的过去式和过去分词 )
调整（镜头，眼睛）焦点[焦距]以便看清

sentence.Network_en: He found the binoculars and focused them on the boat.
sentence.Network_cn: 他找到双筒望远镜，然后调焦对准那艘船看。

sentence.Network_en: They're making judgments based on a narrowly focused vision of the world.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们的判断是基于一种狭隘的世界观。

sentence.Network_en: It's as if all eyes are focused on me.
sentence.Network_cn: 好像所有的目光都聚集在我身上似的。

entry.tran: 有明确目标的;注意力集中的
entry.def: If you describe someone or something as focused, you approve of the fact that they have a clear and definite purpose.

example.ex: I spent the next year just wandering. I wasn't focused...
example.tran: 接下来的一年我一直在闲逛。没有什么明确的目标。

example.ex: The band's third album seems more disciplined and focussed...
example.tran: 这个乐队的第三张专辑似乎表现更为节制、基调更为清晰。

means.word_mean: 1. of an optical system (e.g. eye or opera glasses) adjusted to produce a clear image
2. being in focus or brought into focus
3. (of light rays) converging on a point;

sentences.sentence: "focused light rays can set something afire"

means.word_mean: 4. concentrated on or clustered around a central point or purpose

auth_sentence.content: I say focused but it felt quite the opposite.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: I say focused but it felt quite the opposite.

auth_sentence.content: The technology leaps in nuclear are focused on safety.
auth_sentence.res_content: The technology leaps in nuclear are focused on safety.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The technology leaps in nuclear are focused on safety.

auth_sentence.res_content: Capital Link's Forum focused on three major topics.

Sentence.sentence: Students focused more on test scores.
Tony Little, headmaster of Eton, warned that boys were being faded by the British education system because it had become too focused on girls.
In face of global warming, much effort has been focused on reducing greenhouse gas emissions through a variety of strategies.
Organizations cannot thrive without being focused on their desired end results any more than an individual can thrive without goals to provide a sense of purpose
Interest in this aspect of the settlement has focused on "orphan" works, where there is no known copyright holder – these make up an estimated 5-10% of the books Google has scanned.
